# Arpeggio: Minor 7th in B

An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played in succession, rather than simultaneously. A Minor 7th arpeggio in the key of B consists of the notes B, D, F#, and A.

## Notes and Intervals

1. B - The root note
2. D - Minor 3rd interval from B
3. F# - Perfect 5th interval from B
4. A - Minor 7th interval from B

The notes in the Minor 7th arpeggio create a unique sound and harmony that give a rich and melancholic feel to music.

## Genre and Musical Flavor

The Minor 7th arpeggio is commonly used in jazz, blues, R&B, and funk music. It adds a soulful and jazzy flavor to compositions, creating a sense of tension and sophistication. When played in a melodic context, it can convey a sense of longing or introspection.

## Songs

1. **"Blue Bossa" by Kenny Dorham**: This jazz standard features the Minor 7th arpeggio prominently in its melodic lines.
2. **"Ain't No Sunshine" by Bill Withers**: The iconic piano riff in this soulful tune incorporates the Minor 7th arpeggio.
3. **"Chameleon" by Herbie Hancock**: A fusion jazz masterpiece that showcases the versatility of the Minor 7th arpeggio in a funky setting.
